pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body:
Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8736543622/job/23971604022)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8736543622/job/23971603407)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8736543622/job/23971603833)

```suggestion
@[continuity, fun_prop]
theorem continuous_sqrt : Continuous sqrt := sqrt.continuous
```
We should probably decide whether to standardize on `fun_prop` or `continuity`, but it'll be easier to refactor later if every relevant lemma is tagged with `@[continuity]` anyway.

```suggestion
  StarOrderedRing.of_le_iff fun f g ↦ by
```
can you rename this lemma now that `StarOrderedRing` is a prop? (There are a few other offenders in the same file...)
This is probably best as a standalone PR, since it would touch quite a few files
Will do in a separate follow-up PR
#12089 I'll update whichever PR ends up being merged second.

Something I'm curious about; we ended up generalizing `StarOrderedRing` from "every nonnegative element is `star c * c`" to "every non-negative element is a sum of such elements".

Is there an analogy here where `sqrtPieces : R -> Finset R`, and is there any situation in which it is interesting?
None that I know of, especially because you would need to have the same number of pieces. So it would be more like `sqrtPieces : R → ((n : ℕ) × (Fin n → R))` or something to that effect.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: `StarOrderedRing` instances on `ContinuousMap`
